title: A true account of the trial, condemnation, and burning of the Pope at Aberdene in Scotland, January the 11th. 1689 Which was supposed to have been performed by His Holiness in the greatest splendour, having come on purpose to congratulate the good success the Roman-Catholicks had in this kingdom, and more particularly in Aberdene: in order to which His Holiness being seated on a chair of state, with his crown on his head, his keys on his arm, and clothed with scarlet robes lined with ermine; began his procession from the colledge-gate, about four a clock in the afternoon, and was accompanied as follows.
